messages.content: What dataset is mentioned in the context that enables efforts similar to long-tailed recognition in 3D?
ScanNet200
What is the title of the work by Li Jiang et al. presented at CVPR in 2020?
Pointgroup: Dual-set point grouping for 3d instance segmentation.
What is the purpose of using the pseudo-label predictions of the frozen model Φ t−1 in the context of class imbalance?

The purpose is to leverage the pseudo-label predictions as a proxy for the class distribution across previously learned categories, allowing for the accumulation of class-wise frequency statistics for those classes.
What are the two additional components introduced to enhance the performance of Emplar Replay (ER)?
A Pseudo-Label Generator (PLG) and a Class-Balanced Re-weighting (CBR) module.
What challenge does the work address in class-incremental 3D instance segmentation?
The work addresses the challenge of catastrophic forgetting.
What is the primary challenge faced by the model Φ t when learning new classes from the dataset D t?
The primary challenge is to learn new classes without forgetting those encountered in previous tasks, despite limited supervision and the absence of past labels.
What is the title of the work presented by Peng Chu and colleagues at ECCV?
Feature space augmentation for long-tailed data.
What evaluation method is used to compare the proposed framework with the baseline method in the study?
The Split-B evaluation method is used.
What is the title of the paper authored by Jiahao Sun and others that focuses on 3D scene instance segmentation?
Superpoint transformer for 3d scene instance segmentation.
What issue does Class-Balanced Re-weighting (CBR) aim to address in model predictions?
CBR aims to address the issue of model predictions being biased towards frequent classes, which results in the forgetting of rare categories.
What is the title of the paper authored by Yuwei Yang and others presented at CVPR in June 2023?
Geometry and uncertainty-aware 3d point cloud class-incremental semantic segmentation.
What dataset is used for evaluating the approach on CI-3DSS?
ScanNetV2 dataset
What is the purpose of applying class-wise re-weighting in the context of pseudo-label selection?
The purpose of applying class-wise re-weighting is to promote balanced pseudo-label selection.
What is the main focus of the paper by Jiahua Dong et al. published in AAAI in 2021?
The main focus of the paper by Jiahua Dong et al. is on incremental 3D object learning without catastrophic forgetting.
What is the title of the paper authored by Yining Hong and others that discusses injecting the 3D world into large language models?
3d-llm: Injecting the 3d world into large language models
What does the previous model Φ t−1 generate for the previously seen classes from the point cloud and label pair (P,Y t )?
The previous model Φ t−1 generates pseudo-labels denoted as ˆY1:t−1 =Φ t−1 (P), which are referred to as ˜Yt.
What are the gains in mAP 25, mAP 50, and overall mAP achieved by CLIMB-3D in the Split-A scenario?
+19.23% in mAP 25, +16.76% in mAP 50, and +12.28% in overall mAP.
What item is mentioned as being located on the bathroom counter?
coffee kettle
What is the primary motivation for the need for Class-Incremental Learning (CIL) in 3D instance segmentation?

The primary motivation for the need for Class-Incremental Learning (CIL) in 3D instance segmentation is that traditional methods assume all classes are available and balanced during training, which does not hold in real-world environments where new object classes emerge over time and exhibit natural imbalance.
What is the performance improvement percentage for the class 'piano' when using the IC module in Phase 3?
What is the main focus of the paper by Tong He, Chunhua Shen, and Anton Van Den Hengel presented at CVPR 2021?
The main focus of the paper is robust instance segmentation of 3D point clouds through dynamic convolution.
What is the purpose of the Split-C scenario in data labeling?

The purpose of the Split-C scenario is to improve the model's robustness in real-world situations by exposing it to diverse and unpredictable distributions of classes, where any class can appear in any task, resulting in varying levels of class imbalance.
What components are incorporated into the final training objective of CLIMB-3D?
The final training objective of CLIMB-3D incorporates ER, PLG, and CBR components.
What aspect of 3D semantic segmentation is jointly addressed in the discussed work?
Long-tail and continual 3D semantic segmentation.
What is the main focus of the paper by Tianhao Li, Limin Wang, and Gangshan Wu presented at ICCV 2021?
The main focus is on self supervision to distillation for long-tailed visual recognition.
What do the updated weights denoted as w'c aim to achieve in the context of class imbalance?
The updated weights w'c aim to ensure balanced supervision across all seen categories, including rare ones, by incorporating statistics from both previously seen and current classes.
Which paper discusses learning Gaussian instance segmentation in point clouds?
Shih-Hung Liu, Shang-Yi Yu, Shao-Chi Wu, Hwann-Tzong Chen, and Tyng-Luh Liu's paper discusses learning Gaussian instance segmentation in point clouds.
What is the purpose of the Pseudo-Label Generator (PLG) in the CLIMB-3D framework?
The Pseudo-Label Generator (PLG) uses a frozen model from previous tasks to generate supervision for earlier classes.
What is the average precision (mAP) achieved by the CLIMB-3D method in the Split-A scenario?
What is the title of the paper authored by Salman H Khan and others published in 2017?
Cost-sensitive learning of deep feature representations from imbalanced data.
What is the title of the paper authored by Jathushan Rajasegaran and others in 2019?
Random path selection for incremental learning.
What is the purpose of the Pseudo-Label Generator (PLG) in the CI-3DIS setting during phase t?

The purpose of the Pseudo-Label Generator (PLG) in the CI-3DIS setting during phase t is to generate pseudo-labels for previously seen classes using the model from the previous phase, thereby providing approximate supervision during training and allowing the current model to retain prior knowledge and reduce forgetting.
What does the binary mask mi,j indicate in the context of the training dataset?
The binary mask mi,j indicates which points belong to the j-th object instance within the point cloud.
How does the proposed framework's results compare to the baseline method according to the qualitative comparison on the Split-A evaluation?
The proposed framework consistently produces results that are closely aligned with the ground truth, unlike the baseline method.
What is the percentage by which the IC module outperforms ER+KD?
What does the exemplar replay size |E t | represent in the context of the model's training?
The exemplar replay size |E t | represents the number of exemplars stored after phase t.
What is the purpose of Class-Balanced Re-weighting (CBR) in the context of CLIMB-3D?
The purpose of Class-Balanced Re-weighting (CBR) is to enhance the learning of rare classes by estimating class frequencies from the pseudo-labels without accessing past data.
What item is mentioned that is typically used for holding liquids?
water bottle
What is the highest performance metric achieved in the ablation study for the 'Naïve' module during phase 1?
What is one method mentioned for rehearsing older tasks while learning new ones?
Exemplar replay, where past data is stored or generated.
What is the title of the paper authored by Ashish Vaswani and others?
Attention is all you need.
What dataset is used to evaluate the three incremental scenarios for 3DIS?
The ScanNet200 dataset.
What method does the CLIMB-3D model use to maintain a memory of past examples during training?
Exemplar Replay (ER)
What is the primary focus of the Split-B scenario in training models?

The primary focus of the Split-B scenario is on semantic continuity and transfer, as it groups categories based on their semantic relationships and trains the model incrementally on one semantic group at a time.
What is the overall performance of the method after all three tasks in terms of AP50?
What limitations do recent works on scene-level class-incremental 3DIS and class-incremental semantic segmentation face?
They depend heavily on large exemplars and overlook class imbalance, limiting their practicality.
What item is mentioned as being located on the bathroom counter?
Toilet paper.
How many tasks are each of the scenarios Split-A, Split-B, and Split-C divided into?
Each of the scenarios Split-A, Split-B, and Split-C is divided into three tasks.
What is the mAP50 result for the proposed CLIMB-3D method in phase=2 of scenario s1?
What datasets were used in the experiments for CLIMB-3D?
The experiments were limited to indoor datasets ScanNet200 and ScanNetV2.
What is the performance score of the Naïve model in the Split-A scenario?
What is the title of the paper authored by Wayne?
Experience replay for continual learning.
What percentage reduction in points was observed in the results?
Over 22 points.
What is the title of the paper authored by Jonas Schult and others presented at the International Conference on Robotics and Automation in 2023?
Mask3D: Mask Transformer for 3D Semantic Instance Segmentation
What is the primary focus of the paper by Julian Chibane et al. as indicated in the context?
The primary focus of the paper by Julian Chibane et al. is weakly supervised 3D semantic instance segmentation using bounding boxes.
What issue does the baseline method have when identifying instances of the washing machine?
The baseline method incorrectly segments the washing machine into two instances.
What is the main focus of the paper by Yuanzhi Su and colleagues published in 2024?
The main focus is on balanced residual distillation learning for 3D point cloud class-incremental semantic segmentation.
How does the performance of the proposed method in Phase 1 compare to the baseline in terms of AP50?
The proposed method achieves an overall performance of 31.56% AP50, compared to 15.07% for the baseline.
What evaluation metric is used to measure segmentation quality in the CLIMB-3D approach?
Mean Average Precision (mAP)
What is the title of the paper authored by Rahaf Aljundi et al. that discusses memory aware synapses?
Memory aware synapses: Learning what (not) to forget.
What is the overall mIoU achieved by the method discussed in the context?
59.38% mIoU
What specific instances did the baseline method fail to segment as mentioned in the context?
The baseline method failed to segment the sink and missed the sofa instance.
What does CBR mitigate to enhance learning stability?
Class imbalance.
What is the title of the paper authored by Seulki Park and others, and in which conference was it presented?
The title of the paper is 'The majority can help the minority: Context-rich minority oversampling for long-tailed classification,' and it was presented at CVPR.
What is the purpose of computing class-wise weights w in the context of class frequency f?
The purpose of computing class-wise weights w is to guide balanced pseudo-label selection and help the model focus on rare classes.
What appliance is mentioned in the context that is typically used for making hot beverages?
coffee maker
What is the title of the paper authored by Mohamed El Amine Boudjoghra and others?
3d indoor instance segmentation in an open-world.
What is the title of the paper authored by Yin Cui and others that discusses class-balanced loss?
Class-balanced loss based on effective number of samples.
What is the mAP 50 score for the 'trash bin' class when evaluated with the ER + PLG + CBR method?
What is the proposed approach for training the model regarding category frequency?
The proposed approach is to first train the model on the most frequent categories and then incorporate the less frequent ones in later stages.
What method is used to select the most confident instance predictions to mitigate noise in the predictions from Φt−1?
The top-K most confident instance predictions are selected.
What item in the context is used for storing dirty clothes?
laundry basket
What is the main limitation of existing methods for 3D instance segmentation as discussed in the abstract?
Existing methods assume that all object classes are known in advance and uniformly distributed, which is unrealistic in dynamic, real-world environments.
What is the effect of adding exemplar replay (ER) on the performance metrics s1 and s2 in Phase 2 and Phase 3?
Exemplar replay (ER) yields notable gains for s1 in Phase 2 (+18.51%) and Phase 3 (+10.38%), and also improves s2 in Phase 3 (+9.43%).
What is the relationship between the joint set of classes Ct and the sets C t and C t′ during different tasks?
The joint set of classes Ct is defined as the union of the sets C t and C t′, and the intersection of C t and C t′ is not empty for different tasks t and t′.
What is the purpose of the class-balanced re-weighting (CBR) scheme introduced in the context?
The CBR scheme estimates object frequencies from pseudo-labels and dynamically adjusts training bias to mitigate the bias towards frequent classes in the pseudo-label generator (PLG).
What strategy is incorporated to address catastrophic forgetting in the CI-3DIS framework?
Exemplar Replay (ER)
What is the mAP 50 score for the class 'shower' when seen 3 times during an epoch with the ER+KD+IC method?
What are the two types of scenarios illustrated in the CLIMB-3D study?
Frequent Scenario and Random Scenario.
What item is located near the kitchen counter?
Coffee maker
What is the title of the paper authored by Liu in 2020?
Learning gaussian instance segmentation in point clouds.
What is the title of the paper authored by Boyan Zhou and others that focuses on long-tailed visual recognition?
Bbn: Bilateral-branch network with cumulative learning for long-tailed visual recognition.
What is the primary focus of the research presented in the proceedings mentioned?
The primary focus is on a group proposal network for 3D point cloud instance segmentation.
What evaluation dataset is mentioned in the context for comparing the proposed framework?
Split-C evaluation
What does the variable λ represent in the objective function L3DIS?
The variable λ controls the trade-off between the average classification loss L cls and the average mask loss L mask in the objective function.
What is the title of the paper authored by Nitesh V Chawla and others published in 2002?
Smote: synthetic minority over-sampling technique.
What is the title of the paper authored by Jean Lahoud and others presented at the International Conference on Robotics and Automation in 2024?
Long-tailed 3d semantic segmentation with adaptive weight constraint and sampling.
What item in the context is used for cleaning and is typically found in a laundry area?
laundry detergent
What problem does the tailored framework for 3D instance segmentation aim to address?
It aims to effectively transfer knowledge across tasks, even under class imbalance.
What is the improvement in mAP achieved by the proposed method?
The proposed method improves mAP by 5.6%.
What happens to the model's performance when trained naïvely without dedicated modules?
The model suffers from severe catastrophic forgetting, with performance dropping to zero for earlier splits and FPP rising to 56.82.
Which items are listed under Split_A for Task 1?
chair, table, couch, fireplace, desk, office chair, rail, monitor
